results.definition: a list of names
examples: his name was struck off the rolls

results.definition: move along on or as if on wheels or a wheeled vehicle
examples: The President's convoy rolled past the crowds

results.definition: cause to move by turning over or in a circular manner of as if on an axis
examples: They rolled their eyes at his words

results.definition: move by turning over or rotating
examples: The child rolled down the hill

results.definition: a deep prolonged sound (as of thunder or large bells)
small rounded bread either plain or sweet
show certain properties when being rolled
a roll of currency notes (often taken as the resources of a person or business etc.)
examples: he shot his roll on a bob-tailed nag

results.definition: a long heavy sea wave as it advances towards the shore
flatten or spread with a roller
the sound of a drum (especially a snare drum) beaten rapidly and continuously
arrange or or coil around
examples: roll your hair around your finger

results.definition: the act of throwing dice
move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
examples: They rolled from town to town

results.definition: sell something to or obtain something from by energetic and especially underhanded activity
boil vigorously
a round shape formed by a series of concentric circles (as formed by leaves or flower petals)
the act of rolling something (as the ball in bowling)
move in a wavy pattern or with a rising and falling motion
examples: the waves rolled towards the beach

results.definition: a document that can be rolled up (as for storage)
rotary motion of an object around its own axis
occur in soft rounded shapes
a flight maneuver; aircraft rotates about its longitudinal axis without changing direction or losing altitude
anything rolled up in cylindrical form
begin operating or running
emit, produce, or utter with a deep prolonged reverberating sound
execute a roll, in tumbling
move, rock, or sway from side to side
examples: The ship rolled on the heavy seas

results.definition: photographic film rolled up inside a container to protect it from light
pronounce with a roll, of the phoneme /r/
shape by rolling
take the shape of a roll or cylinder
walking with a swaying gait
